author: Brian Turner
method: Heat the olive oil in a frying pan, add the onion and fry until softened. Chop half of the sausage and add to the frying pan. Add the rice and a splash of boiling water and stir until the water is absorbed. Add the spinach leaves and chilli and stir well until the spinach leaves are beginning to wilt. In a separate pan, fry the rest of the sausage until golden-brown all over and cooked through. To serve, spoon the rice onto two serving plates and top with the fried sausage.
ingredients: dash olive oil,  ¼ onion, finely sliced,  200g/7oz boerewors (South African) sausage, or other spiced sausage,  200g/7oz quick-cook rice,  splash boiling water,  large handful fresh spinach leaves,  ½ red chilli, chopped
